item.title: Invesco QQQ Sponsor Spotlight: The Innovation Engine
item.description: Paul Schroeder, QQQ Equity Product Strategist, Invesco speaks with Bloomberg's Mike Olson about tech innovation at Bloomberg Tech in San Francisco. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: CRISPR Is Direct Result of Federal Funding: Doudna
item.description: President Donald Trump on Monday threatened to divert billions in grant dollars away from Harvard University and give those funds to trade schools across the US, escalating his clash with the elite institution. Jennifer Doudna, a winner of the Nobel Prize in chemistry for development of CRISPR gene editing said that federal funding is essential for search like hers to start. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Salesforce Sponsor Spotlight: How to Architect Your AI Agents for Long Term Value
item.description: Madhav Thattai, SVP and COO, Agentforce Product, Salesforce, and Sagar Mehta, CTO, OpenTable discuss how to architect AI agents for long term value at Bloomberg Tech in San Francisco. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump Says He Had Great Relationship With Musk
item.description: President Donald Trump says he had a great relationship with Elon Musk when he was an advisor, now he's not so sure. He speaks in the Oval Office. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Lagarde Says ECB Getting to the End of Monetary Cycle
item.description: The European Central Bank is coming to the end of its campaign of interest-rate cuts following the eighth reduction in a year, according to President Christine Lagarde. She made the comments during her opening statement at the ECB's six-weekly briefing in Frankfurt. Earlier policy makers lowered euro-zone rates for the eighth time in a year to 2%. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Samsung Sponsor Spotlight: Unlocking AI's Potential for a Healthier You
item.description: Hon Pak, Senior Vice President and Head of Digital Health, Mobile eXperience Business, Samsung Electronics, speaks with Bloomberg’s Mike Olson about how AI is driving personalized and preventative healthcare at Bloomberg Tech in San Francisco. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US Deficit Is a ‘Ticking Time Bomb,’ Citadel Securities President Says
item.description: Citadel Securities President Jim Esposito said the US deficit and mounting government debt levels are a “ticking time bomb,” adding his voice to the chorus of financial executives soundings warnings about America’s deteriorating fiscal outlook.
item.dc:creator: Katherine Doherty, Bernard Goyder

media:content.media:description: The US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Thursday, June 5, 2025. US House Speaker Mike Johnson said he is fighting to maintain the new $40,000 cap on state and local deductions in the draft tax bill now before the Senate, where Republicans are seeking to enact a less generous break.

item.title: Taiwan’s Money-Market Rate Slump May Delay Central Bank Easing
item.description: A surge in the Taiwanese dollar last month spurred an influx of funds, driving local money-market rates to the lowest level in more than a year and potentially delaying monetary easing by the central bank.
item.dc:creator: Chien-Hua Wan

item.title: A Hong Kong Dollar Drop to Weak End of Band May be Short-Lived
item.description: The Hong Kong dollar is expected to spend a shorter amount of time under pressure than recent bouts of weakness, thanks to forecasts for a softer greenback and seasonal factors.
item.dc:creator: Iris Ouyang

item.title: Traders Scour Annual Meeting Filings for Activist Clues in Japan
item.description: Traders are scouring notices of annual general meetings to pick up signals about activist holdings in Japanese companies and profit from potential spikes in stock prices.
item.dc:creator: Yasutaka Tamura

media:content.media:description: The Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE) building, operated by Japan Exchange Group Inc. (JPX), in Tokyo, Japan, on Thursday, April 10, 2025. Stocks in Japan and South Korea jumped the most since August on Thursday as a reprieve in higher US tariffs on most nations lured buyers back to the beaten-down market.

item.title: How BLK & Bold's Social Impact Mission Helps Growth
item.description: Rod Johnson, BLK & Bold Co-Founder speaks with Romaine Bostick about starting their coffee business and how it is affected by today's landscape. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: This Is a Disaster for Elon Musk, Gerber Says
item.description: Ross Gerber, president and CEO of Gerber Kawasaki Wealth and Investment Management, says Elon Musk's public clash with President Donald Trump is a disaster. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Circle Doubles in Wild First Day of Trading for Stablecoin Firm
item.description: Circle Internet Group Inc. had one of the splashiest debuts in years, with shares surging 168% after the company and some of its shareholders raised nearly $1.1 billion in an upsized initial public offering.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes, Monique Mulima, Emily Mason

media:content.media:description: Chief Executive Officer Jeremy Allaire, center left, during the company’s initial public offering on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange on June 5.

item.title: Circle’s Frenzied Trading Debut Boosts Crypto IPO Prospects
item.description: Circle Internet Group Inc.’s white-hot debut on Thursday gives the US IPO market a crypto-fuelled shot of adrenalin that could encourage more listings by would-be debutantes — in the digital assets space and beyond.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

item.title: Emerging Assets Surge on Risk Rally Fueled by Bleak US Data
item.description: Emerging-market assets surged across the board Thursday, after a fresh batch of US jobs data strengthened expectations for a more dovish Federal Reserve, weighing on the dollar.
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Butler, Maria Elena Vizcaino, Raphael Almeida

media:content.media:description: The rising Kospi and Korea Value-up indices displayed at the Korea Exchange in Seoul, on June 4.

item.title: LinkedIn Exec Says AI 'Taking Over' Entry-Level Work
item.description: Aneesh Raman, LinkedIn, Chief Economic Opportunity Officer speaks with Romaine Bostick about the job market with the future of AI. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Tanger CEO on Diversifying Shopping Experience Offerings
item.description: Stephen Yalof, Tanger CEO & President speak with Romaine Bostick about the retail outlook in the outdoor Tanger outlets. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump Feud a ‘Disaster’ for Musk, Ross Gerber Says
item.description: “The board of directors at Tesla is the weakest group of individuals that have ever stepped foot on a board,” Ross Gerber, president and CEO of Gerber Kawasaki Wealth and Investment Management, says while reacting to the drop in Tesla shares after Elon Musk and President Donald Trump’s simmering feud devolved into a public war of words. Gerber speaks on “Bloomberg The Close.”

item.title: Colombia Bonds Drop on Reports Fiscal Rule May be Suspended
item.description: Colombia’s sovereign dollar bonds dropped across the curve on Thursday after local media reported that the government might suspend the fiscal rule that limited budget spending and helped steady the markets for more than a decade.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Bristow, Zijia Song

item.title: Stocks Fall as Trump-Musk Fight Sinks Tesla by 14%: Markets Wrap
item.description: Stocks fell alongside Treasuries as online squabbling between President Donald Trump and Elon Musk knocked down Tesla Inc., weighing heavily on the megacap tech space.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

media:content.media:description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Katie Greifeld, David Gura, Emily Graffeo.

item.title: Rivian CEO on New EV Fleet and Navigating Tariffs
item.description: RJ Scaringe, Founder and CEO of Rivian, speaks with Bloomberg’s Emily Chang at Bloomberg Tech in San Francisco about the company’s newest electric vehicles, the impact of shifting US trade policy, and Rivian’s strategy for scaling sustainable innovation. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Silver Gains Ground on Gold With Jump to Highest Since 2012
item.description: Silver surged to the highest in 13 years, powered by a technical breakout, as investors broaden demand for the safety of precious metals beyond gold.
item.dc:creator: Jack Ryan

media:content.media:description: One kilogram gold bars at the ABC Refinery smelter, operated by Pallion, in Sydney, Australia, on Thursday, April 17, 2025. Gold paused its record-breaking rally amid optimism over US-Japan trade talks, after bullion earlier reached another all-time high. Photographer: Brendon Thorne/Bloomberg

item.title: Perplexity CEO Srinivas on Winning Search With AI
item.description: Aravind Srinivas, Co-Founder and CEO of Perplexity, speaks with Bloomberg’s Shirin Ghaffary about the startup’s approach to reinventing online search, rising investor interest, and how Perplexity plans to stay ahead in the AI innovation race at Bloomberg Tech in San Francisco. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US Refrains From Using Currency Manipulator Tag, Blasts China
item.description: In the first formal assessment of US trading partners’ foreign-exchange practices since President Donald Trump returned to office, the Treasury Department declined to name any country a currency manipulator while singling China out for “its lack of transparency.”
item.dc:creator: Daniel Flatley

media:content.media:description: The U.S. Treasury Department building in Washington, D.C., U.S., on Saturday, June 26, 2021. The Federal Reserve might consider an interest-rate hike from near zero as soon as late 2022 as the labor market reaches full employment and inflation is at the central bank's goal.

item.title: Peloton CEO Stern on Product Innovation & Future Growth
item.description: Peter Stern, President and CEO of Peloton Interactive, shares his vision for the company’s next chapter, from product innovation to digital transformation. He joins Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman to discuss what’s next for the fitness leader at Bloomberg Tech in San Francisco. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Peloton CEO Says He Has No Interest in Selling the Company: Full Panel
item.description: Peloton CEO Peter Stern joins Bloomberg's Mark Gurman at the Bloomberg Tech Summit to talk the company's growth goals, its use of AI, and why he is not interested in selling. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Stocks Slide as Trump-Musk Conflict Sends Tesla Shares Tumbling
item.description: US stocks tumbled, posting their first daily loss this week, as shares of Tesla Inc. dragged broader indexes down amid escalating tensions between Elon Musk and US President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Natalia Kniazhevich

item.title: What Did Germany's Merz Accomplish in Meeting With Trump?
item.description: Council on Foreign Relations Fellow for Europe Liana Fix discusses the meeting between President Trump and Chancellor of Germany Friedrich Merz, Germany’s defense spending and trade. She speaks with Vonnie Quinn on "Bloomberg Markets." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Circle CEO Allaire on Going Public, Stablecoin Adoption
item.description: Circle co-founder and CEO Jeremy Allaire discusses the company’s initial public offering and the outlook for cryptocurrency adoption on “Bloomberg The Close.” Circle Internet Group shares surged as much as 235% after the company and its shareholders raised nearly $1.1 billion in an IPO.

item.title: Microsoft Chief Product Officer on the AI Shift
item.description: Aparna Chennapragada, Microsoft Chief Product Officer of Experiences and Devices, talks about the transformation of the world of work with AI and how productivity will be impacted by the new technology. She speaks with Ed Ludlow and Caroline Hyde live from the Bloomberg Tech Summit in San Francisco. (Source: Bloomberg)
